channel.title: Mastodon Home Timeline
channel.description: RSS feed for the Mastodon Home timeline

item.title: Kristian Harstad
item.description: People are getting paid for #publishing #AI-written #books, in an #author's name, when in fact the author did not, and knew nothing about this happening.Then, when the author tries to do something about it to stop this obvious #abuse, they are told no.

item.title: Earl K. Miller
item.description:
Changes in theta, gamma, and beta synch during working memory. More evidence for beta as a top-down control signal. Groovy.Task-specific oscillatory synchronization of prefrontal cortex, nucleus reuniens and hippocampus during working memory
https://doi.org/10.1016/j.isci.2023.107532

item.title: Daniel Hart Baker
item.description: @mick I had a great experience at Neurons, Behavior, Data analysis & Theory. Similar remit to JoN, but it‚Äôs a diamond open access overlay journal, so basically the future of publishing! Reviewers were constructive and pleasant:https://nbdt.scholasticahq.comFor human imaging work, Imaging Neuroscience is probably where it‚Äôs at these days:https://janeway.imaging-neuroscience.org

item.title: mekka okereke :verified:
item.description: The unspoken context behind the "Battle of Montgomery" video:* When media mentions "blue collar" jobs, they usually picture rural white folk. But... most employed Black and Latinx people work blue collar jobs, and most people live in cities. In the US, blue collar employees are Black and brown.ü§∑üèø‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è* Blue collar employees are often asked to enforce rules, (like mask mandates).* When racist white people get drunk, they often use slurs against, spit at, or physically strike these Black workers.

item.title: Thiago Carvalho
item.description: "The depiction of Africa as the place without history was the product rather than the cause of the enslavement and forced migration of over 12 million Africans, followed by the colonial conquest of the continent."https://www.nybooks.com/articles/2023/08/17/africa-the-center-of-history-born-in-blackness-howard-w-french/

item.title: jordan
item.description:
Preprint from a small side project I worked on in the @kordinglab: A framework for automatic evaluation of open-ended questions, so that you can review course material on your own or enrich Jupyter notebooks with thoughtful questions!
https://arxiv.org/abs/2308.02439
#llm #preprint #jupyter #edutech

item.title: Amy Diehl, Ph.D.
item.description: New mom tracks the data finding time spent nursing, pumping and missing work when child care fell through was an average of¬†26 additional hours per week,¬†turning eight-hour workdays into 13-hour days. A job that was unpaid and largely unseen. https://www.huffpost.com/entry/new-mom-track-baby-data_n_64bd7be7e4b093f07cb51742

item.title: Ember Manning
item.description: Hi Fediverse! I got laid off last week!I've got a PhD in Computational Linguistics and have been working for the last couple years as a Linguist on Google Assistant.My expertise is mainly in (a) linguistic annotation and (b) evaluation methods for Natural Language Generation (NLG). But I'm potentially interested in anything that will let me play with language data, or even language and/or data.I'm currently in the NYC area and would love to stay here, but I'm open to relocating elsewhere in the US, as long as it's not to one of the states that trans people are fleeing from.My mom said I should go back on Twitter to post about this, so getting me #FediHired would be a great way to prove that that's not necessary üòâ#GetFediHired

item.description: Will you be in Bristol in early September‚ùì Would you like to learn how to use PsychoPy to make an eyetracking experiment? üëÅÔ∏è üëÅÔ∏è Come along to the British Psychology Society pre-conference networking event! ü§ì https://www.bps.org.uk/event/cognitive-and-developmental-preconference-networking-event

item.title: mekka okereke :verified:
item.description: You know the deal. Ohio just narrowly avoided a horrific election result again, and once again a part of the US was saved by "young" voters. So everyone is restating the same nonsense about how "young" voters will save us, or how the older generation is more "conservative" or how people get more "conservative" as they get older."Young" voters will not save us.People do not get more conservative as they get older.https://hachyderm.io/@mekkaokereke/109609941910796255
